msIdentifier.repository: Gonville and Caius College, Lower Library
msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 790/812

summary.seg: The manuscript contains a collection of Greek ascetical texts comprising sermons by Isaac of Nineveh (Isaac Syrus), mystical theologian of the 7th century, John Chrysostom (5th c.) and others together with a series of Apophthegmata Patrum (“Sayings of the Fathers”), anecdotes and maxims by the Egyptian Desert Fathers. Such collections of texts are frequently found in Greek manuscripts, as books which had a particular value within monastic communities.

The codex was copied by a single scribe, probably in the 17th century. A later hand wrote some annotations in the margins and a final note on the verso of the last leaf of the manuscript, mentioning a monastery τοῦ τιμίου προδρόμου, confirming the probable production and use of the manuscript in a monastic milieu.

msItem.title: Oratio ante lectionem
msItem.rubric: f. [2]v Εὐχὴ Ἰωάννου τοῦ Χρυσοστόμου ἐν τῷ μέλλειν ἀναγινώσκειν, ἢ ἀναγινώσκοντος ἑτέρου ἀκροᾶσθαι
msItem.incipit: f. [2]v Κύριε Ἰησοῦ Χριστὲ ὁ θεὸς ἡμῶν, ἄνοιξον τὰ ὦτα
msItem.explicit: f. [2]v ἵνα σύ μου φωτίσῃς τὴν καρδίαν.
msItem.note:
The text is attributed to
John Chrysostom‎ John Chrysostom, Saint, -407 ‎ , but is considered spurious

msItem.author: Isaiah, Abba, -489 or 491
msItem.title: Asceticon, excerpts
msItem.incipit: f. 3r Ἀδελφὲ, ἐὰν νεώτερος ἦς μήπω ποιήσας τὴν δουλείαν τοῦ σώματος
msItem.explicit: f. 4v ἐφ' οἷς ἔχουσι φυσωμένους ὑπερηφάνους νοητέον.
msItem.note: Εd. A. Iordanites, Τοῦ ὁσίου πατρὸς ἡμών ἀββᾶ Ἡσαΐου λόγοι κθ΄, Jerusalem 1911 (ed. repr. by S.N. Schoinas, Volos 1962)
CPG 5555

msItem.author: Isaac, Bishop of Nineveh
msItem.title: Sermones ascetici
msItem.rubric: f. 5r Τοῦ ἐν ἁγίοις πατρὸς ἡμῶν Ἰσαὰκ τοῦ Σύρου καὶ ἀναχωρητοῦ ἐπισκόπου γενομένου τῆς φιλοχρίστου πόλεως Νινευὶ λόγοι ἀσκητικοὶ ἑρμηνευθήσις ὑπὸ τῶν ὁσίον πατρῶν ἡμῶν Πατρικίου καὶ Ἀβραμίου τῶν φιλοσόφων καὶ ἡσυχαστῶν· ἐν τῇ μονῇ τοῦ ὁσίου πατρὸς ἡμῶν Σάββα
msItem.finalRubric: f. [107]v Τέλος τοῦ Ἀββᾶ Ἰσαὰκ τοῦ Σύρου
msItem.note: The sermons are numbered; the numbering, the order and the division of the sermons do not correspond to the most recent critical edition of the text (Pirard 2012)
Ed. M. Pirard, Ἀββὰ Ἰσαὰκ τοῦ Σύρου Λόγοι ἀσκητικοὶ, Ἅγιος Ὄρος, Ἱερὰ Μονὴ Ἰβήρων 2012; CPG 7868
CPG 7868

msItem.title: Sermon 6 (Pirard)
msItem.note: The text of sermon 6 (Pirard) is followed on ff. [48]v l. 13-[57]v l. 15 by a part of sermon 27 (Pirard), with some lacunae, a series of questions and answers, see Pirard 2012, pp. 444 l. 124-464 l. 534

msItem.title: Sermon 7 (Pirard)
msItem.note: In the margin the scribe wrote λόγος ζ΄

msItem.title: Sermon 10 (Pirard)
msItem.note: In the margin the scribe wrote λόγος ι΄

msItem.title: Sermon 12 (Pirard)
msItem.note: In the margin the scribe wrote λόγος ια΄
Pirard 2012, pp. 350-352 with differences

msItem.author: John of Dalyatha (active 8th century)
msItem.title: Sermon
msItem.note: The text has been excluded from Isaac's collection in Pirard (2012) (it is sermon 2 in Theotokes' edition, N. Theotokes, Τοῦ ὁσίου πατρὸς ἡμῶν Ἰσαὰκ έπισκόπου Νινευὶ τοῦ Σύρου εὑρεθέντα ἀσκητικά, Leipzig 1770 ); for the text see Pirard (2012), pp. 813-817
In the margin the scribe wrote λόγος ιϛ΄

msItem.title: Sermon 16 (Pirard)
msItem.note: In the margin the scribe wrote λόγος ιθ΄

msItem.title: Sermon 17 (Pirard)
msItem.note: In the margin the scribe wrote λόγος κ΄
The text of sermon 17 (Pirard) is followed on ff. [79]v l. 17-[80]r l. 3 by a part of sermon 20 (Pirard), see Pirard 2012, p. 409 ll. 154-158

msItem.title: Sermon 30 (Pirard)
msItem.note: Pirard 2012, pp. 508-507; sermon 30 (Pirard) follows the preceding one without interruption

msItem.title: Sermon 32 (Pirard)
msItem.note: Pirard 2012, pp. 525-530; the text starts imperfectly at p. 529 l. 91

msItem.title: Sermons 37-38 (Pirard)
msItem.note: Pirard 2012, pp. 550-565, with differences; the text in the manuscript ends at p. 565 l. 97

msItem.title: Sermon 41 (Pirard)
msItem.note: Pirard 2012, pp. 574-594, with numerous lacunae
On ff. 101r-[107]v l. 4 follow various excerpts from sermons of Isaac of Nineveh, without interruption

msItem.rubric: f. [107]v l. 2 Περὶ τὰς τέσαρας γενικᾶς ἀρετάς
msItem.incipit: f. [107]v Περὶ φρονήσεως. Ἡ φρόνησις καὶ τὰ περὶ ἐκείνην
msItem.explicit: f. [113]r l. 14 λάθριος συκοφαντία.

msItem.rubric: f. [113]r l. 15 Περὶ τῶν τοῦ ἀνθρώπου ἐπιθέτων
msItem.incipit: f. [113]r Τὰ τοῦ ἀνθρώπου ἐπίθετα
msItem.explicit: f. [115]v κατὰ τὸν σοφὸν Σολομῶντα.

msItem.title: Questiones et responsiones, excerpt (question 5)
msItem.rubric: f. 116r Τοῦ ἁγίου Ἀναστασίου ἀπόκρησις πρὸς τὰς προενεχθήσας αὐτῷ ἐρωτήσας περὶ τίνων ὁρθοδόξων· περὶ διαφόρων κεφαλαίων
msItem.incipit: f. 116r Ἐρώτησις α΄. Τί ἐστι τὸ σημεῖον τοῦ τελείου Χριστιανοῦ;
msItem.explicit: f. 116v l. 5 καὶ ἐπέσχάτων αὐτῆς βόθρος ᾅδου
msItem.note:
The text is attributes to
Anastasius, Sinaita Anastasius, Sinaita but is considered spurious

msItem.title: Text attributed to John Chrysostom
msItem.incipit: f. 116v Ποιήσατε φησὶν, ἀξίους καρποὺς τῆς μετανοίας τουτέστιν ἠρπάσω
msItem.explicit: f. [118]v l. 9 ἔλαφρόν ἐστι.

msItem.title: Micah, 8
msItem.rubric: f. [118]v l. 10 Mηχαίου τοὺ προφήτου λόγος
msItem.incipit: f. [118]v Ἀνηγγέλλη σοι ἄνθρωπε, τὶ καλόν
msItem.explicit: f. [118]v l. 12 μετὰ τοῦ θεοῦ σου.

msItem.title: Zacharias, 8
msItem.incipit: f. [118]v Τάδε λέγει κύριος παντοκράτορ· κρίμα δίκαιον κρίνατε
msItem.explicit: f. 118v l. 12 λέγει κύριος παντοκράτωρ.
msItem.note: The text is partially different from the edition

msItem.title: Text attributed to Isaias
msItem.incipit: f. [119]r Ζητῆσαι τὸν θεόν καὶ ἐν τῷ ἐγγίζειν αὐτόν
msItem.explicit: f. [119]r l. 3 ἐπιστράφητε πρὸς κύριον καὶ ἐλεηθήσεσθαι

msItem.title: Ecclesiasticus sive Siracides (Sapientia Jesu filii Sirach), 10-11
msItem.incipit: f. [119]r Ἐμβλέψατε εἰς τὰς ἀρχέας γενεὰς
msItem.explicit: f. [119]r l. 7 διότι οἰκτίρμoν καὶ ἐλεήμoν ἐστίν

msItem.title: Parable of Christ from the Gospels
msItem.rubric: f. [119]r l. 7 Παραβολὴν ἐκ τοῦ Εὐαγγελίου
msItem.incipit: f. [119]r Εἶπεν ὁ κύριος· αἰτεῖται καὶ δοθήσεται ὑμῖν
msItem.explicit: f. [119]r l. 10 καὶ τῷ κρούοντι ἀνοιγήσεται
msItem.note: This is present in both Matthew's (7. 7-8) and Luke's (11. 9-10) Gospels

msItem.title: Text attributed to Maximus the Confessor
msItem.incipit: f. [119]r Ταῦτα μὲν τῶν ἀφ' ἡμῶν πραττομένων κατὰ θεόν
msItem.explicit: f. [119]v l. 17 ἐγὼ ἐφύλαξα ὁδοὺς σκληράς
msItem.note: The last part of the text, f. [119]v ll. 12-17 is an extract from Maximus Confessor's Capita de caritate (TLG 2892.008), book 2, sect. 24

msItem.author: Anastasius, Sinaita
msItem.title: Questiones et responsiones, excerpt (question 73)
msItem.incipit: f. [119]r l. 17 Ἐρώτησις. Πόθεν ὁρῶμέν τινας πιστοὺς σωματικὰ πταίσματα ποιοῦντας
msItem.explicit: f. [121]r l. 5 καὶ ἐπέσχάτων αὐτῆς βόθρος ᾅδου
msItem.note: The text does not coincide with the printed one, it is longer

msItem.incipit: f. [121]r Tίνος ἕνεκεν ὁ Ἡσαῦ ἐπλούτει, ὁ δὲ Ἰακὼβ
msItem.explicit: f. [122]r l. 6 ὅ τ'ἂν ἀνάξιοι τῆς εὐεργεσίας φανόμενοι.
msItem.note: The beginning of the text, f. [121]r ll. 5-17 corresponds to John Chrysostom, In epistulam i ad Corinthios, PG 61, 247 ll. 3-21 (TLG 2062.156); the final sentence, f. [122]r ll. 5-6, correponds to a preceding passage of the text, PG 61, 204 ll. 39-42

msItem.title: Text attributed to Isaac, Bishop of Nineveh
msItem.incipit: f. [122]r Ἐὰν τὸν Παῦλον ὠφελῇ πειρασμός
msItem.explicit: f. [123]v l. 1 καὶ γίνεται ὁ ἄνθρωπος ὅλος πνευματικός.
msItem.note: For the beginning of the text see Isaac of Nineveh, Sermones ascetici, Sermon 51 Pirard (Ed. M. Pirard, Ἀββὰ Ἰσαὰκ τοῦ Σύρου Λόγοι ἀσκητικοὶ, Ἅγιος Ὄρος, Ἱερὰ Μονὴ Ἰβήρων 2012, p. 663 l. 45)

msItem.author: Symeon Metropolitan of Euchaita
msItem.title: Epistula ad Iohannem monachum
msItem.rubric: f. [123]v l. 2 Τοῦ μακαρίου Ἰωάννου μητροπολίτου Εὐχαίτων, ἐπιστολὴ πρὸς Ἰωάννην μοναχὸν καὶ ἔκλειπον· αὕτη δὲ ἀρμόζει καὶ παντὶ κελλιώτῃ
msItem.incipit: f. [123]v Ἐδεξάμην σου πάτερ πνευματικέ τὴν θεοφιλῆ ταύτην γραφήν
msItem.explicit: f. [134]r l. 12 εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας τῶν αἰῶνων αμήν.
msItem.note: In the title the epistle is attributed to John Mauropus, Metropolitan of Euchaita

This text is present also, inter alia, in MS Vat. gr. 1868, see P. Canart, Codices Vaticani Graeci. Codices 1745-1962, 1, Vatican Ciry 1970, p. 410, also for the bibliography on the text and its author

msItem.rubric: f. [134]r l. 12 Περίλογον καὶ σιωπῆς καὶ πῶς δεῖ καί ποτε τοῦτας χρᾶσθαι· καὶ ὅτι τὸ ἀργολογεῖν, οὐκ ἀνέγκλητον Παλαδίου, καὶ Θεωδόρου τοῦ Σαββαίτου
msItem.incipit: f. [134]r Μακρὰν ἀπὸ σοῦ τὸ πολύρρημον
msItem.explicit: f. [134]v ὡς ἐξ αὐτοῦ τοῦ θεοῦ.

msItem.title: Apophthegmata patrum et varia ascetica
Sayings of the Fathers and various ascetical texts
msItem.incipit: f. [135]r Ἀδελφὸς ἡρώτησε τὸν ἀββᾶ Ποιμένα· ἐὰν θεάσωμαι πρᾶγμα
msItem.explicit: f. 158r ἐκ τοῦ ἐπαίνου καὶ ψώγου τῶν ἀνθρώπων.
msItem.note: The first title has been written by the scribe in the upper margin of f. [135]r; it is repeated on f. [140]r, where there is another apophthegm mentioning abbas Poemen, who is mentioned several times afterwards (apophthegmata mentioning him are contained in MS Firenze, Biblioteca nazionale centrale, Nuovi acquisti 437
The apophthegms alternate with short ascetical texts attributed to Isaac Syrus, Maximus and others

msItem.author: John Chrysostom
msItem.title: Ad eos qui scandalizati sunt (excerpt)
msItem.incipit: f. 158v Παλαίστρα ὁ παρὼν βίος ἐστί
msItem.explicit: f. [159]r l. 6 καὶ ἐμφράξαι τοῦ διαβόλου τὸ στόμα.
msItem.note: Only an excerpt: A.-M. Malingrey, Jean Chrysostome. Sur la providence de Dieu, Paris 1961, pp. 52-276: ch. 21, sect. 1 l. 5

msItem.title: Text attributed to John Chrysostom
msItem.incipit: f. [159]r Καὶ ταῦτα τοίνυν ἅπαντα ἀναλέγοντες
msItem.explicit: f. [159]v ᾧ ἡ δόξα εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας τῶν αἰώνων ἀμήν

support.material:
Western paper, folded in quarto. Watermarks: ff. [1]-[141] Letters ? in the gutter, the watermark is faintly visible.
ff. 142-[160] Flowers with a crown ? in the gutter, the watermark is faintly visible.

collation.p: The manuscript consists mainly of quaternions. The last folio of the last quire is the right pastedown.
collation.catchwords: Horizontal catchwords by the scribe in the lower margin, right, on each folio recto and verso.
collation.signatures: Modern quire numbering in pencil, in the lower right corner of the first leaf verso, from 1 to 21.

supportDesc.condition: The manuscript is in fair condition. The binding is very stained. The leaves have not been trimmed regularly. There are brown stains and mould stains passim throughout.

handNote.p: f. [1]r-[159]v Hand A: the texts were written by a single scribe, in a minuscule script slanting slightly to the right, characterized by a tendency to the extension of uprights, rapid, but still accurate. The scribe did not use iota subscript.
The text is written in black ink; titles and initials in red, which is often obsidated.

Hand a: another hand wrote a few annotations in the margins, not always following the text direction (see e.g. ff. [27]v-[28]r), and on f. [160]v, in a minuscule informal script, cursive, slanting to the right.
The text is written in a grey ink

additions.p: On f. [1]r there are some notes in pencil, probably by a librarian: Isaac Syrus Logoi | MS | Manuscript | Greek, XVII s. (in a blue pencil).
On f. [160]v Hand a wrote a note in Greek mentioning a monastery τοῦ τιμίου προδρόμου

binding.p:
Western limp leather binding. On the spine are pasted two paper labels with the two shelfmarks 812 (in red) and 790 (in black). In the left cover has been inserted a paper leaf written by hand A, and containing parts of two texts by
John Chrysostom‎ John Chrysostom, Saint, -407 ‎, , De beato Philogonio (= Contra Anomoeos, homilia 6) (TLG 2062.014) and In Psalmum 50 (homilia 2) (this is a spurious text, TLG 2062.200).
225 170 33

accMat.p: In the mauscript is preserved a paper slip, on which are written a few words by hand A, τὸ δὲ ἀντιστῆναι τῇ λήθῃ, ταῦτα πάντα φυλά . There was writing also on the other side, but only traces are visible. The right border of the slip is stained.

origin.p: The manuscript was copied by a single scribe probably in the 17th century, as the script indicates.

history.acquisition: Nothing is currently known about the way in which the manuscript came into the College Library; in the catalogue it is described as a later acquisition. On f. [1]r is pasted the Gonville and Caius College bookplate.

recordHist.source: Description (2021) partly draws on M. R. James, Supplement to the catalogue of manuscripts in the library of Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 1914, pp. 39-40.

availability.p: Visitors to Gonville and Caius College who wish to consult Lower Library material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Gonville and Caius College: Library Information.

monogr.title: Supplement to the catalogue of manuscripts in the library of Gonville and Caius College
